Package interfaces

Class Weapon

java.lang.Object
interfaces.Item
interfaces.Weapon
Direct Known Subclasses:
Pistol, Rifle, Shotgun, SMG, Sniper
public abstract class Weapon extends Item
Represents an abstract projectile weapon that can be used by the player.

This class includes information about the properties of the weapon. See the constructor for more information on the meanings of these statistics.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    RECOIL_COOLDOWN
    The delay, in milliseconds, until a recoil variation on the bullet's velocity will no longer be applied.

  • Field Details

    • RECOIL_COOLDOWN

      public static final int RECOIL_COOLDOWN
      The delay, in milliseconds, until a recoil variation on the bullet's velocity will no longer be applied. After this time, no random variation will be allied and the direction of the velocity resultant vector will point exactly at the mouse. Before this time is finished, a random variation angle will be applied (decreasing accuracy).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Weapon

      public Weapon(int damage, double velocity, int firerate, double range, double recoil, double mobility, int capacity, int reloadTime, int cost, int moneyPerKill, double barrelLength)
      Constructs a new Weapon object with 1 round per shot.
      Parameters:
      damage - the damage dealt by one projectiles from this weapon, in terms of HP.
      velocity - the velocity of a projectile, in tiles/sec.
      firerate - the rate of fire, in rounds per second.
      range - the effective range of this weapon in tiles.
      recoil - the maximum recoil angle in radians.
      mobility - the movement speed multiplier of the player while carrying this weapon in the interval (0, 1].
      capacity - the capacity of this weapon before reloading is required.
      reloadTime - the time, in milliseconds, to reload.
      cost - the cost to buy this weapon from the shop.
      moneyPerKill - the amount of money earned by the attacking player using this weapon.
      barrelLength - the length, in tiles, of the barrel. Used to determine bullet pos.

    • Weapon

      public Weapon(int damage, double velocity, int firerate, double range, double recoil, double mobility, int capacity, int roundsPerShot, int reloadTime, int cost, int moneyPerKill, double barrelLength)
      Constructs a new Weapon object with a variable number of rounds per shot.
      Parameters:
      damage - the damage dealt by one projectiles from this weapon, in terms of HP.
      velocity - the velocity of a projectile, in tiles/sec.
      firerate - the rate of fire, in rounds per second.
      range - the effective range of this weapon in tiles.
      recoil - the maximum recoil angle in radians.
      mobility - the movement speed multiplier of the player while carrying this weapon in the interval (0, 1].
      capacity - the capacity of this weapon before reloading is required.
      roundsPerShot - the number of bullets created each time fire is called.
      reloadTime - the time, in milliseconds, to reload.
      cost - the cost to buy this weapon from the shop.
      moneyPerKill - the amount of money earned by the attacking player using this weapon.
      barrelLength - the length, in tiles, of the barrel. Used to determine bullet pos.

    • penetration

      public double penetration()
      Returns the effectiveness of this weapon against a player in armor. Penetration is a linear function of velocity in the interval [0, 1] where 0 represents complete ineffectiveness against armor (no damage) and 1 represents total effectiveness against armor (full damage).
      Returns:
      the penetration of bullets fired by this weapon.

    • fire

      public Bullet[] fire(double x, double y, double rad)
      Fires this weapon and returns the bullets fired.
      Parameters:
      x - the x position, in tile space, where the projectile originates from.
      y - the y position, in tile space, where the projectile originates from.
      rad - the angle, in radians, to which the velocity vector of the projectile points.
      Returns:
      a list of Bullet objects fired by this weapon.
      See Also:
      • Bullet

    • fireBlank

      public void fireBlank()
      Completes the client-side routine of firing this weapon. This includes decrementing the number of bullets left, playing the weapon fired sound, and performing the reload routine if needed. This method does not create a bullet.
